intro: Microseris acuminata, commonly known as the sharpshooters' garlic, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant features basal leaves that are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a short, cylindrical silique that contains several seeds. Microseris acuminata is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks.
